revised_title: Cholesterol Content and Growth in Chickens: The Impact of Different Diets
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the cholesterol content in growing chickens under different diets. They found that the cholesterol content in chickens remained relatively constant regardless of the diet, suggesting that cholesterol is a conserved substance in the animal organism. The study also showed that chickens could thrive on a diet devoid of cholesterol and phytosterol.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Physiology
